Finding aid updated as part of the College Archives Survey

did.unittitle: Smith College International Summer Institute records
did.abstract: The program offered high school girls, foreign nationals or U.S. citizens living abroad, an opportunity to spend one month at Smith pursuing their academic interests. Records contain primarily correspondence, evaluation forms, course descriptions, student work, photographs, and general information about the Institute.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Smith College International Summer Institute was proposed in 1996. The program offered high school girls, who were foreign nationals or U.S. citizens living abroad, an opportunity to spend one month at Smith pursuing their academic interests. The program was divided into two blocks of two weeks each in which the students would study computer science, English, psychology and economics while also working on individual research projects. The Institute operated successfully during the summer of 1997 with 13 students from 11 different countries. The program for the summer of 1998 was cancelled in late May.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The International Summer Institute files, contain primarily correspondence, publicity, photos and general information about the Institute. Of particular note are the evaluation forms regarding the quality of the program, course descriptions and examples of some of the research projects completed by participants in 1997.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into three series:

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Smith College International Summer Institute records, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-00085, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use with following restrictions on access: Budget materials are closed for 25 years from the date of creation and information about student participants and staff is closed for 75 years from the date of creation.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records of the Smith College International Summer Institute were delivered to the College Archives by the director of the program, Kathleen Lyu Ryan, in August, 1999. Accession #: 99A-98

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is unrestricted information about the Institute and its activities.

did.unittitle: Kathleen Ryan's Lists of Things to Do
Training for Residential Directors and Interns
Young Women's Leadership School of East Harlem

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains files that are closed due to their confidential nature. The budget and billing materials are restricted for 25 years from the date of creation while the materials on students and staff are restricted for 75 years from the date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the files of the students who were accepted into the program for 1997 and 1998 and are restricted for 75 years from the date of creation.
